module.title: Arrays & Objects
module.description: Work with collections of data using arrays and objects

lessons.title: Arrays
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Arrays store ordered lists: `[1, 2, 3]`
- Access by index: `arr[0]`
- Methods: `push`, `pop`, `shift`, `unshift`, `splice`
- `.length` gives the count

---

# Arrays
lessons.codeExample:
const fruits = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"];

console.log(fruits[0]);     // "apple"
console.log(fruits.length); // 3

fruits.push("date");       // add to end
fruits.pop();              // remove from end

// Check if item exists
console.log(fruits.includes("banana")); // true

lessons.title: Array Methods
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- `map()` transforms each element
- `filter()` keeps elements passing a test
- `find()` returns first match
- `reduce()` combines into one value
- These return new arrays (immutable)

---

# Array Methods

lessons.title: Objects
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Objects store key-value pairs: `{ name: "Alice" }`
- Access: `obj.name` or `obj["name"]`
- Nest objects and arrays inside objects
- `Object.keys()`, `Object.values()`, `Object.entries()`

---

# Objects

lessons.title: Destructuring & Spread
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- Destructuring extracts values: `const { name } = user`
- Array destructuring: `const [first, second] = arr`
- Spread: `...` copies/merges arrays and objects
- Rest: `...rest` collects remaining items

---

# Destructuring & Spread
